ThingDef.label: Hotsuit
ThingDef.description: Specialized thermsuit which sees use in hot environments. Uses evaporative agents to siphon heat away from the user, like sweating.

ThingDef.label: Coldsuit
ThingDef.description: Specialized thermsuit which sees use in cold environments. Uses exothermic chemical resoviors to generate heat, like hand warmers.

ThingDef.label: Thermsuit
ThingDef.description: Thermsuit: Combines the systems of the hotsuit and coldsuit, enabling comfort in shifting temperatures, at the cost of reduced performance.

ThingDef.label: Hotbelt
ThingDef.description: An additional resovior of evaporative agents allows the hotsuit's cooling systems to run harder and longer, at the cost of weight.

ThingDef.label: Coldbelt
ThingDef.description: An additional resovior of exothermic chemicals allows the coldsuit to run hotter and longer, at the cost of weight.

ThingDef.label: Thermbelt
ThingDef.description: Two additional resoviors of exothermic chemicals and evaporative agents, respectively for the thermsuit. Allows increased performance, but still inefficient.

ThingDef.label: Thermal helmet
ThingDef.description: A well-insulated and filtered helmet with a large glass viewport, designed for use with a thermal suit.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Gamma helmet
ThingDef.description: A bifurcaded metal plate with a mechanical connection to the rest of the armor. Armor like this is worn by interior soldiers and scouts in the Iron Accord, where mobility is a larger concern than total protection.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Gamma officer helmet
ThingDef.description: This helmet's distinct look is derived from additional respirator, audio-receptor and loudspeaker equipment, all chemically powered. It is more delicate, but confers unique advantages.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Gamma armor
ThingDef.description: A series of angled metal plates, supported by pulleys and levers, and included anabolic treatments. Armor like this is worn by interior soldiers and scouts in the Iron Accord, where mobility is a larger concern than total protection. Does not cover lower limbs, or the back.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Beta helmet
ThingDef.description: A heavy bifurcated metal plate with a bracing mechanical connection to the rest of the armor. Armor like this is worn by common footsoldiers of the Iron Accord, who operate outside vehicles and fight boarding attempts and raiding parties.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Beta officer helmet
ThingDef.description: This helmet's menacing visage is derived from additional respirator, audio-receptor and loudspeaker equipment, all chemically powered. It is considerably more delicate, but offers unique boons.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Beta armor
ThingDef.description: A series of heavy, angled metal plates, supported by robust pulleys and levers, and included higher-performance anabolic treatments. Armor like this is worn by common footsoldiers of the Iron Accord, who operate outside vehicles and fight boarding attempts and raiding parties.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Alpha helmet
ThingDef.description: A giant metal block with enough room for a head, and the levers and pulleys that make it possible to move your head with it. Armor like this is worn by elite soldiers of the Iron Accord, and may as well be the posterboy: The steroids will kill them before 30 if the combat doesn't.

ThingDef.label: MFAS-Alpha armor
ThingDef.description: An obscenely heavy full-metal shell with very few chinks and very thick plates supported by equally thick levers and pulleys, akin to a walking tank. Armor like this is worn by elite soldiers of the Iron Accord, and may as well be the posterboy: The steroids will kill them before 30 if the combat doesn't.

ThingDef.label: Theta-Exohelmet
ThingDef.description: A bubble helmet that seals with it's respective EVA suit to confer complete protection in hard vacuum. Hauntingly reminiscent of the ancient astronauts. Suits like these are worn by ship crew and pilots in the Iron Accord, to keep them alive in the event of a hull breach.

ThingDef.label: Theta-Exosuit
ThingDef.description: A sealed and pressurized full-body suit meant to protect the user in hard vacuum. Hauntingly reminiscent of the ancient astronauts. Suits like these are worn by ship crew and pilots in the Iron Accord, to keep them alive in the event of a hull breach.

ThingDef.label: Officer's Theta-Exohelmet
ThingDef.description: A worryingly fragile but advanced spacesuit helmet with a number of handy chemically-powered features, and unique design. It offers especially potent advantages.

ThingDef.label: Trench helmet
ThingDef.description: A fairly normal flak helmet, built without ballistic fabrics. Armor like this is worn by Iron Accord drivers, as it's effective against shrapnel and spalling.

ThingDef.label: Officer's Trench-hat
ThingDef.description: This helmet boasts a wider, more aggressive appearance thanks to additional respirator and loudspeaker equipment. Slightly delicate but confers minor advantages.

ThingDef.label: Trench armor
ThingDef.description: A fairly normal flak jacket and vest, built without ballistic fabrics. Armor like this is worn by Iron Accord drivers, as it's effective against shrapnel and spalling.

ThingDef.label: Fieldsuit
ThingDef.description: The most basic of Iron Accord uniforms. Durable, but not much to it.
